post.title: Folake Owodunni Wins Global Aurora Tech Award 2024
post.excerpt: Nigerian Folake Owodunni has been named the recipient of the Global Aurora Tech Award 2024. Owodunni’s victory was announced on International Women’s Day.
post.content:
For her innovative firm, Emergency Response Africa, Nigerian Folake Owodunni has been named the recipient of the Global Aurora Tech Award 2024. Owodunni’s victory was announced on International Women’s Day.

Access to healthcare is a top priority for Emergency Response Africa. This ground-breaking approach meets pressing regional requirements by delivering long-term, scalable emergency medical care.

Head of the Aurora Tech Award, Ekaterina Smirnova, commented on the importance of Owodunni’s accomplishment, saying that the honour serves as a continual reminder of the crucial role that women play in driving change and innovation.

“We celebrate the remarkable achievements of Folake Owodunni, Hannah Töpler, and Sarah Phiri-Molema. Their groundbreaking startups not only address critical needs in their communities but also serve as local role models, inspiring change and fostering innovation. These awards play a vital role in providing much-needed recognition to women in the tech industry, amplifying their contributions, and paving the way for greater gender equality and diversity in innovation,” Smirnova said.

This year’s record-breaking 694 applications from 102 countries highlight the global effect of women in technology and innovation. The Aurora Tech Award 2024 was established in 2020 by inDrive, a US-based global mobility and urban services platform.

Along with the esteemed merit, the top three finishers in the 2024 Aurora Tech Award competition will receive cash awards of $30,000, $20,000, and $10,000, respectively. Additionally, all three winners will have the opportunity to participate in the inDrive mentorship programme.

Aspiring women entrepreneurs all over the globe can look up to Folake Owodunni as an example of how ingenuity and perseverance can make a difference; her victory at the Aurora Tech Award 2024 is an exemplar of this.

node.title: Rose-Margaret Ekeng-Itua has become the first black woman to hold a PhD in Cybernetics
node.excerpt: An award-winning Nigerian Professor, Rose-Margaret Ekeng-Itua, has emerged as the first black woman in the world to earn a doctorate (PhD) in Cybernetics, which is the scientific study of control and communication in animals and machines, concerned with understanding complex systems like learning, cognition, adaptation, emergence, communication, and efficiency.
